title: Slow boot times
solutions: Enable fast startup in Windows power options
Disable unnecessary startup programs
Test with a different power cable
Update motherboard BIOS
Check for hard drive errors using chkdsk
Consider upgrading to an SSD
Disable Windows search indexing temporarily

title: Low gaming performance
solutions: Update graphics drivers to latest version
Check GPU and CPU temperatures during gaming
Lower in-game graphics settings
Close background applications
Enable XMP/DOCP for RAM in BIOS
Check if GPU is properly seated and powered

title: System freezing or crashing
solutions: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic to test RAM
Check system temperatures - clean dust from components
Update all drivers, especially GPU and chipset
Run system file checker (sfc /scannow)
Check Windows Event Viewer for error logs
Test with default BIOS settings (disable overclocking)

title: High CPU or Disk usage
commonSymptoms: 100% CPU or Disk in Task Manager
solutions: End unnecessary background tasks using Task Manager
Disable startup apps that are resource-heavy
Scan for malware using Windows Defender or Malwarebytes
Turn off Windows Tips and Background Apps
Check for Windows Updates stuck or looping
Reset or rebuild Windows search index

title: Apps take too long to open
commonSymptoms: Loading cursor spins for a long time
solutions: Check for available RAM and close unused apps
Update the application and Windows OS
Run system file checker (sfc /scannow)
Reinstall or repair the problematic app
Scan for viruses or corrupted files
Ensure app is not installed on a failing drive

title: PC overheating or running loud
solutions: Clean dust from fans, CPU cooler, and GPU
Reapply thermal paste if needed
Improve airflow in the case (add intake/exhaust fans)
Use software to monitor temperatures (e.g., HWMonitor)
Ensure fans are spinning properly and connected
Replace stock cooler with more efficient aftermarket one
